Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: fellowtraveller007
Reviews.Content: Location wise, this i was an excellent hotel, located on one end of Las Ramblas; within walking distance of many attractions and the metro. The hotel only povided breakfast and it was a good spread. View from the standard room wasn't great...it was another wall. But then we didn't spend a lot of time in the room, nor did we want to spend extra for te view. So it was ok. Reception staff were very helpful. All in all a good stay, for a basic clean standard accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MJordan3
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights in early April. We thought that it was an ideal location to all the sites, as it is right on the Rambla, so just a couple of blocks down the road is the Placa de Catalunya. We stumbled across the Casa Mila which is right behind the hotel, so it's great if you want to get up early in the morning to queue to see that. The rooms are very large with a nice balcony looking over the street. They were also very clean and had it's own bike machine. One problem though was that it got very hot and stuffy in the rooms and we ended up with very dry mouths in the morning! The breakfast was disappointing as there was only cold food on the buffet like salami and cheese, and wasn't really enough to keep us going the whole day. Cooked food had to be ordered for an extra charge. Also slightly odd because the rooms were really modern but the rest of the hotel seemed a bit dated and needed an uplift. It would have been nice if the swimming pool was open in the Spring as the views from the roof would have probably been pretty cool. Staff were very friendly and helpful and would show you directions to landmarks, and phoned up taxis for you, and helped us when we needed to print out our boarding passes on the way back. All in all, we would definitely stay here again, but breakfast was very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: The Teacher7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights over the Easter weekend. It's in an ideal location, not far from a couple of Gaudi designed buildings and within easy walking distance (15mins) of the Placa de Catalunya. The nearest metro stop is the Passeig de Gracia, which also has suburban trains stopping there, so you can get to and from the airport direct without having to change. Perfect! On our arrival, we were warmly welcomed by the gentleman on reception. He upgraded us from a standard double to a superior double, for no extra cost. Our room was on the first floor and had obviously been improved recently and looked onto the Rambla de Catalunya. I was worried about it being too noisy to sleep, but very little street noise could be heard. Both the room and bathroom were really clean and we could find no fault. Breakfast was a buffet affair, with plenty of choice. Tables are VERY close together and staff were a little thin on the ground. We were told that a hot breakfast was available, but this was not obvious when in the breakfast room. Having said that, we had more than enough choice. On checking out, we asked the receptionist a question regarding the 3 day travel ticket we had purchased. She didn't know the answer, but she quickly checked the appropriate website and then phoned someone. Most other hotel staff would have dismissed it with an "I don't know" but not at the Regente.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for expolring”
Reviews.Author: sue802
Reviews.Content: Really friendly, helpful staff. Room was great, requested balcony room and got room with a terrace! Excellent base to explore Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Dayna_Travels
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel HCC Regente primarily because of its excellent location and reasonable cost through Air Transat Vacations. The hotel itself would be barely a 3 star in Canada. The rooms are small but if you are lucky enough, and we were, to get a balcony view, the view more than makes up for the room size. Breakfast appears to be continental, but there is acutally a hot item menue. The wait staff will not ask you if you would like to order from the hot menue. You need to chase them down for that. Forget the bar, no ambience, dark, and no bartender ?? BUT, a perfect location to explore the many wonderful sights and restaurants in the Ramblas area. And, the reception staff were quite helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: travel393
Reviews.Content: Great location for exploring the city Agree with other reviewers that the room can make or break the feedback. The first night we had a small dark room which was rather tired, however we managed to change the next day when a tour group left. The second was a marvellous bright spacious room with views right over Barcelona from our own roof top balcony. The Reception staff are excellent and helped us out with some missing football tickets that we had delivered to the hotel. Breakfast was a little under staffed but due to the good selection of fruit, pastries and hot and cold drinks this didn't cause a problem. Having arrived late on the first night Reception pointed us in the direction of some nearby restaurants, one being the 5J cinco jotas which is one block up to the right on the opposite side of the street.. We ate there more than once, great little find. On return from our stay I realised I had left some photographs, which arrived through my home letterbox less than a week later!! Many thanks to a lovely Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No hot water”
Reviews.Author: Faxoe
Reviews.Content: Very centrally located hotel with nice rooms and pleasant and helpful staff in the reception, however - in the breakfast restaurant they were under staffed every morning in 5 days. The cleaning in the rooms wasn’t impressive, but most important, lack of hot water in the morning shower were a problem almost every day.

Reviews.Title: “The disappointing part of the holiday”
Reviews.Author: Grace A
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel partly because of the mention that it was an Art Nouveau building, which we thought would have some character. Unfortunately it did not. Apart from a few stained glass windows dotted around, there was nothing interesting about the hotel. The decor in the hotel generally was bland and, after looking through the door we didn't even go into the bar. The bedroom on the 7th floor, although having a view towards the mountains, was quite small and very average. The ceiling needed painting and the whole room could have done with some redecoration. The bathroom was adequate and clean, although the towels were often very thin, and I discarded a number daily in an effort to find some better ones, something I don't normally like to do. There was wi-fi in the bedroom but the code had to be renewed every two days. Trying to use it early in the morning sometimes required me to dress and go to reception for a new code and password. Perhaps another system could be devised so that guests had access to the internet for the duration of their stay, without having to keep renewing. The good thing about this hotel was the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff, who answered all our questions knowledgably and tried their best to help, even though there seemed to be a lack of staff in the dining room at times. Our overall impression was that the management were trying to save money, to the detriment of the guests. from GKA

Reviews.Title: “Terrible rooms, Horrible service. DO NOT STAY”
Reviews.Author: AJ K
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review sitting in Room 401 on our first night here. On a 10-day trip in Spain with the last 2 days in Barcelona, we picked this hotel because of the location and the generally positive reviews posted here. And thus far our experience has been nothing but TERRIBLE. We checked in at 8 PM and got what is probably *the worst* room in the hotel - Room 401. 1) The room overlooks an elevator shaft or some other shaft on the interior of the building, which probably has a drain opening somewhere. The view from our room consists of a bare wall with metal pipes and the stench of a dead otter. (Another review has specifically commented on this room as well). Fine, I can understand that not each room will have a view, and we're willing to settle on this. 2) The AC does not work, and the room feels like the inside of a marathon runner's shoe. Being a Sunday, the staff refuses to do anything except call the service engineer tomorrow. When I asked "what about tonight? How do we sleep in this heat?", the response was - "Well, it's not like this is summer. The weather is good outside. You can sleep". Yes, I would even be willing to sleep with the windows open if that damn shaft didn't stink like a dead otter. 3) The electronic lock on the main door malfunctioned, locking us out for 30 minutes. The receptionist called the security guard, who was generally helpful and let us in, but again "We will call the service engineer tomorrow". Yes, this is all in the first 4 hours of being in this hotel. I don't know what else to look forward to. DEFINITELY never staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: retiredsurrey
Reviews.Content: Well presented hotel in good location. The staff were friendly and helpful, and, on the desk, English speaking. (In fact, throughout the city we found restaurant staff etc. to be very amiable in dealing with non-Spanish speaking Brits.) We were given rooms opening on to the internal shaft, but put up with it for the sake of the absence of noise. Apart from someone banging about for a short period one night, it was peaceful even with the window open. The aircon was fairly unobtrusive at low level, and the temperature comfortable despite the warmth outside (even in October). The rooms and bathrooms were clean, of decent size and comfortable. We had an Airmiles 3 nights for 2 deal with breakfast thrown in, so it all seemed pretty good value: the breakfast was very good with lots of choice. One minor quibble: the coffee came out in jugs with just a flap on top and lost heat quickly, so if you want your coffee really hot, pounce on a fresh jug. The terrace bar and pool (which is tiny) were closed, but it was worth making our way up to the roof for a look at the views. And there was a vending machine if you are desperate for a soft drink. There are plenty of eating places in the centre strip of the Ramblas within staggering distance of the hotel, and we tried one out one evening when too tired and hungry to go further. It was expensive and, to be kind, mediocre; perhaps we were just unlucky. We did much better in the Gothic Quarter with two higher quality and cheaper dinners and a good tapas lunch at three separate places. But it's a bit of a walk from the hotel, and you may find yourself wandering round a maze of medieval streets at night. We found the the Gaudi "temple" wonderful, including a slightly scary descent from a tower by foot (you can take the lift). But, my dear, the noise and the people! I gather that you can avoid the coach parties by arriving early, but with us that was never going to happen.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to explore a great city from”
Reviews.Author: Goonergirl62
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here now about three times in all. The only issue I have is that when booking, we always ask for a balcony and they always say they cannot guarantee one which, of course, is ridiculous. But, we have always had one. The first time we booked the top floor with the huge terrace which had views of the Pedrera. Barcelona, like any other Spanish city, is noisy but the Regente is located a bit further up the Rambla and consequently a bit quieter. Especially as you go higher up the building. We love sitting on the balcony, glass of wine in hand and watching everybody underneath. I had bad food posioning the last time we stayed - not from the hotel, I hasten to add, and I spent the whole day in bed. The staff were really helpful and bought me water, when I asked for it. Give it a go; it really is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: SallyEmm
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Barcelona and the Hotel Regente. If you are looking for a value for money hotel in an excellent location, with friendly, courteous staff, then the Regente will be hard to beat. This is not a 'boutique' hotel, but it is clean, the rooms are comfortable, and the free wifi and the rooftop pool and sundeck is a bonus (especially welcome after a busy day of sightseeing). The first time we stayed at the hotel we were given a room at the back of the hotel with a view of the lift shaft - this time we asked for a room at the front - overlooking the Rambla and were really pleased that our request was granted, it made a big difference to our stay. We will certainly visit Barcelona again - (it is a fantastic city) and will happily stay at the Regente. Our booking was made through airmiles and included breakfast - if I was going to book the hotel direct I think a room only option would be the best value for money choice as there are so many excellent bars and cafes serving breakfast within a short stroll from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice of an economy hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Peripatetic_Moose
Reviews.Content: A good smaller (about 50 rooms) economy hotel with Art Nouveau lobby and facade. Excellent location on La Rambla de Catalunya. We walked to most of the sights that we visited. An abundance of very acceptable restaurants steps from the hotel. An eating delight. Staff at hotel was invariably courteous and helpful. Room was clean and comfortable although not overly large. Try to get a room looking onto La Rambla. I spent many enjoyable minutes lounging on the balcony overlooking the street. Appreciated the free wifi and room safe. The included breakfast was very good with sufficient variety. I will definitely book here next time we visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “a lovely hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: yvcymru
Reviews.Content: having read other reviews before going wasn't sure what to expect. Room was clean and made up every day. air con was working fine. bed very comfortable. spare pillow in wardrobe. shower was fine. beautiful views up to the mountains(7th floor). Breakfast was good. cooked b'fast made at request, but abundant cold menu including fruit, cereal, meats, cheese, toast croissants rolls cakes, as much tea/ coffee/ juice / water as wanted. smoking rooms available. good location. staff friendly and helpful. room available straight away (arrived 10 am). coffee making facilities in room would have been nice. pool like a big bath but didn't have time to use anyway. minibar was very expensive. bar and room service close by 11pm. booked the tour bus-hop on/off. 30 euros for 2 days. with small discounts to the attractions.didn't want to use metro-miss too much. very organised but busy. staff very polite. 2 days not long enough. go early to sagrada familia. we got there at 11.30 and queue was massive. beware on beach-gangs targeting bags left unattended.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel that i was in all over Europe”
Reviews.Author: sharonz1
Reviews.Content: hi, first time that i am recommending for an hotel !. just come back from barcelona :( . was there for 4 nights with my wife and we had great time there. i would like to recommend the HCC regente hotel, the hotel location is execellent - 9 min walking from the catalonia plaza (walking in catalonia rambla street that it a great street - full of store + resturants). the room was great - good bed (not double but good enough) the toilet \ shower room looks like new. the service in the hotel is excellent (every day they replace towel + cleaning the room) and the people that worked it the hotel where so nice. when we checkout we asked if we can stay until 14:00 and they said ok without any problems. its for sure that will come back to this hotel - had best time over there. i truly recommand to all.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, excelent localization”
Reviews.Author: rebeccarsh
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel because its localization is perfect! The service is also very good. For women, I recomend bring your own hairdryer, because the hotel´s one seems like a vaccum cleaner!!!

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay and would go back there again”
Reviews.Author: Liz4858
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed the hotel, which we found to be very well located, close to shops and restaurants, there was an excellent tapas bar just around the corner from the hotel. We found the best way to get around Barcelona was The Metro, we brought a T10 ticket which means you have 10 exits so you can travel around all the major tourist spots, much cheaper than the Bus Touristic which was 23 Euros per person per day. We liked Mount Juic and the Picasso Museum. Breakfast was pleasant in the hotel and the staff helpful, I agree with a previous review that it is difficult to get suitcases up the stairs but all in all it was clean, well located and a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Regente, Barcelona - Short Break”
Reviews.Author: dohoPoole
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regente on April 6 for four nights. The location is very good but extremely noisy all the time as it is right on the junction of two very busy roads. We had to sleep with the doors closed and the air conditioning on which was quite uncomfortable. The noise continues into the early hours of the morning. The staff are polite and helpful for information. Good buffet breakfast with just about everything including bacon, eggs and sausage, scrambled eggs, omelette.One of the reasons we choose this hotel was the fact that it had a roof terrace so that we could relax in the late afternoon for an hour or so before going out in the evening. We realised that the pool was closed but it does not state on the website that the terrace is closed also at this time of year. The balcony of the room (203) was to small to sit on. A room higher up in the hotel may have helped with the noise. Taller de Tapas is a good place to eat on this rambla also La Bodequita - very popular. We bought a three day ticket which you can use for the buses, metro, tram and funicular - everything seems to run on time and frequently. The cable car tup to Montjuic is well worth the trip for the spectacular views of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Ador23
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in Barcelona. There was a problem with the hotel I originally booked to stay at and was transferred to this hotel. The staff was all very friendly, the room was very nice and clean throughout. The location was away from the main road so noise was not too bad and not too far from the city centre. Good view from the balcony. The only downside was the steps to enter the hotel was difficult to manage with the suitcases.

Reviews.Title: “great location - pity about the air-con.”
Reviews.Author: glennaberdeen_8
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the 28th.Oct. for a five night break.To get into the hotel there is set of steps which could prove to be troublesome for any elderly guests as there was no bell-boy service(officially 4 starred remember).Check-in was efficient.On entering the room I noticed that the carpet could have done with a good shampoo.Not that it was dirty just marked in places.The room was very warm so I tried the air-con.only to be met with warm air.Contacting reception I was told that it was now winter and that the air-con was now off and the central heating was now in operation.That night we sweltered with the window closed- to open it would let in the heavy traffic noise.We elected to have the window open for the rest of the stay.Temperatures while we were there were in the high teens,low twentys which I was informed was unusual for this time of year thus no air-con. The Regente could not have a better position-ten minutes walk to the Plaza Catalunya and the start of Las Ramblas.Walk though to the port a further 15-20 minutes walk away with the little sides streets on your left leading to the Old town.Also within five to ten minutes walk from the hotel away from the main drag are a multitude of well-priced restaurants:Argentinian,Vietnamese,Thai and Spanish.The reception staff are more than happy to give recommendations-Be warned,however,these restaurants cater for the locals who dont eat early so some dont open till nine o clock but the food is of a good standard(Our favourite was an Argentinian restaurant called Pampero-check it out!!!!) Finally,on our return I managed to drop our passports on the taxi to the airport.Realizing this at check-in I called the hotel and they contacted the taxi company who got our passports to us within fifteen minutes.This impressed us greatly and gives a lie to Spanish inefficiency.Also I would like to take this opportunity to thank the cab driver and receptionist at the Regente.Maybe this hotel should be rated 3 star for the room quality but ,in my book,5 star by the fiendly and helpful staff.Based on this I can recommend this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “accommodation-large room but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: charliedog190773
Reviews.Content: first time to Barcelona-hotel is well located for the shops and restaurants, however, very noisy. well proportioned bedroom but very hard beds-got two single beds rather than one double. Good bathroom with a superb shower. Breakfast not included as too expensive and wanted to enjoy local food.

Reviews.Title: “Use with Caution”
Reviews.Author: RegCork
Reviews.Content: Though the hotel was conveniently located for the main tourist areas and the port it is in fact a 3 star not a 4 star property. Though the staff were very friendly my abiding memory was returning to the hotel early (22.15 hrs) on the saturday, we were moving on the following morning, and decided to have a drink. The main hotel bar was closed and we were directed to the terrace bar. This bar was then closed at 22.30 hrs but not before we were charged €10.98 for a vodka and sprite, the most expensive, and weakest, drink I ever encountered in Spain or anywhere else over quite a few years. I suppose this explains the empty bar.

Reviews.Title: “good location dont take your trunks”
Reviews.Author: j0hn08
Reviews.Content: stayed for two nights enjoyed barcelona hotel was clean although a bit noisy ,room was big enough no view from room ,breakfast was continental not cooked hotel staff were helpful and the rooftop view is good although i wouldnt call it a pool on top

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Valleyboy23
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fabulous long weekend stay at this hotel - I took other guests advice and made contact by email prior to travelling - It was out 20th anniversary, so I aranged via the hotel staff for flowers in the room, and kindly requested a high floor - We had a room on the 6th floor with a fantastic view, spent the early evenings sitting on the balcony with a drink (when I spoke to staff to thank them for their help, i was told the room had been held for 2 days to ensue we had the room we wanted) In relation to the breakfast, they now advertise the fact hot food is available. Travelled to Girona Airport via Ryan Air, Barcelona bus and then underground,and was pleasantly suprised how smooth and effortless the journey was. The weekend was eventful, Catalan Independance march on sat and the world cup final on the sunday ! Barca was bouncing, but I always felt safe , but we were cautious on the Ramblas as advised. I would recommend the tourist bus, we went site seeing all day on the sat, getting on and off whenever we liked, and the Nou Camp is fantastic and worth the money - The beach was also worth a visit. I would definately return to this hotel, the staff couldn't do enough for you.- Great location, not to close to the Ramblas. Finally, the Calalania tapas bar nearby (which was recomended in earlier reviews) is very good, but do go early as it gets very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: WOBM
Reviews.Content: For the money we paid for this Hotel we couldnt have asked for more. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful and were always on hand for whatever we needed. The rooms were fairly standard but this didnt matter as we were barely ever there for anything other than sleeping! The rooftop terrace is also absolutely stunning with its swimming pool and incredible views of the whole city. From the Sagrada Familia to the famous Casa Mila built by Gaudi, everything is clearly viewable from the terrace. Perhaps the best thing about the hotel tho is its location. It is situated just a 5 minute stroll from Placa de Catalunya, which connects to La Rambla. If you choose to use the Metro, you are never more than 20 minutes away from any of the city's attractions. All in all, highly reccommended and perfect for a short weekend break

Reviews.Title: “Central location, hotel nice”
Reviews.Author: Mimiwu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great central location, located over the other side of main square and within walking distance of Las Rambes. The posh shops situated just around the corner with beautifcal architecture everywhere. There is a metro station situated about 300 meters away. The hotel room was ok and the hotel is decorated traditionally. Breakfast was included which was a nice touch & hotel staff friendly. Stayed 3 nights and overal had no complaints apart from need thicker pillows!

Reviews.Title: “worse view from a room i have ever had”
Reviews.Author: rew36
Reviews.Content: sitting writing this from room 401 there is wall 2 metres infront of window and another 2 metres each side. if i look up all i see is metal extractor pipes and the same down.I travel extensively for business and this is by far my worse view. Not staying my planned 7 nights so unable to comment on the breakfast etc. Room itself is clean and tidy but for 150 euro excl. breakfast i expect at least some daylight!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, no complaints, great location”
Reviews.Author: mum_and_3boyz
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this particular hotel with a friend for 4 nights. The hotel itself was fine clean, comfortable and the staff were pleasant. The room wasn't huge but we didn't mind as we were out all day . The location is excellent as it is situated in what appears to be a particularly safe upper end shopping district. It is also just a 10 minute walk from Las Ramblas and the heart of the city. The breakfast was good but way overpriced at almost Eur 20 per person. One point I would like to make is that that while I had no complaints about the hotel I would not describe it as a 4 star even tough it is rated so. I would think it is more like a good 3 star. Saying that, I would still recommend it. There is a really nice restaurant one block down (out the door and turn left) called El Raco. The food is really good and a large glass of red wine cost only Eur 2.15 !

Reviews.Title: “clean friendly and good access point”
Reviews.Author: harpies
Reviews.Content: impressed with hotel just whatt two couples wanted clean, quiet with comfortable beds and not too far to walk to main sites breakfast fine ( if coffee always a bit cold) and enough to start us off

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - enjoyable stay !”
Reviews.Author: Monkedadda
Reviews.Content: The Regente is situated in the heart of the classier part of central Barcelona . Much nicer than the the lower part of the Rambla . Staff were all very pleasant , rooms a little small but that is the only down side to the hotel . The room were imaculate and more than adequate for our needs . The hotel is near quality shopping and only a short walk to the nearest metro station . To summarise I would not hesitate to return if I return to the city ..

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Adam099
Reviews.Content: Yes friends, the HCC Regente is all about location, especially if this is your very first trip to Barcelona ! The hotel is ideally located on the Rambla de Catalunya, minutes walk from the famous Ramblas and market, enshrouded in wonderful shops, and again a stones throw from the famous shopping malls and areas of Barcelona. To top it all, take a hop on hop off tour of Barcelona on an open top bus to get your bearings and take it from there - HCC is again just minutes away from the main tourbus stops !! So its all about location here. The hotel is a nice,warm place, rooms far from ultramodern but there's space enough in them and the premises and rooms are kept spotless. The room rates are very competitive, especially if you take how much you save on taxis etc., into consideration. Staff are very attentive and helpful, always willing to assist with questions, directions, recommendations and ticket reservations. Take into consideration that reserving tickets (tourbus, flamenco shows etc.) at the hotel can save you a couple of Euros too ! Downsides - well we chose bed only basis as breakfast in the region of 20 Euro per person seemed a little steep. Again, the hotel is located amongst a myriad of tea/coffee restaurants etc., so you will easily find a good breakfast close by - considerably cheaper. I recommend the Mauri teashop - a 5 minute walk away - fresh sandwiches, cakes, coffee, hot chocolate, lunch etc.etc. in a great atmosphere - but dont touch the food before you pay - there's a woman there who I think is the famous Seinfeld Soup Nazi's aunt who will tut tut at you and almost say "no cake for you !" if you just dare touch her puffed pastries before paying !!! All in all, our first holiday was fantastic, and the HCC Regente had a lot to do with this success. We will definitely return there in future !

Reviews.Title: “This hotel never fails”
Reviews.Author: corsakingHarrogate
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd visit to this hotel and Barcelona. I have always been impressed by the efficiency and politeness of staff from Reception to room attendants. I was there only for 5 nights and the bedding and towels were changed regularly. The location is superb . You can walk to both cathedrals, to the Olympic stadium , the bull ring, the harbour, Plaza de la Catalyuna where you can catch the tourist bus, and the famous market adjacent to Las Ramblas. Samuel Johnson wrote "[ "When a man is tired of London he is tired of life; for there is in London all that life can afford." and that is equally true of Barcelona. So to those thinking about it -just do it , you wont be disappointed Prices have increased about 20per cent on last year so to cut costs dont eat in touristy areas.Try the upper end of Rambla Catalunya and the side streets. Dont book a taxi from one of the online transfer companies. A return transfer is roughly £80 A fare from the airport by black and yellow taxi is about 30 euros so return is 60 approx £60 This hotel is approx 15 min walk from Plaza Catalyuna where the airport bus stops and picks up-a cheaper alternative. As a solo traveller , you will have nothing to fear being on your own even at 2 in the morning.You dont see groups of rowdy young men or women stoned out their head unless of course they are English , however to be fair ive never seen any bad behaviour by anyone. Take the usual precautions you would anywhere , look after your personal belongings. I was casually waving a camera about in Las Ramblas but never felt it was going to be wrenched out of my hand. Ive grown to love the Spanish , in fact ive been having an affair with Spain since my teens -I love the place and the people.I carnt wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Pool tiny, rest of hotel ok”
Reviews.Author: penkiBristol
Reviews.Content: The rooftop pool is no bigger than a plunge pool - you would be hard pushed to take more than two strokes in a length and 1 in a width - very disappointing as we booked the hotel for relaxing by the pool as we were in Barcelona for personal reasons and did not want to go sightseeing. Rooms are clean and fairly well furnished and breakfast buffet good. Area in which it is situated is relatively safe although compared to the Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Bland, Boring, dated, unfriendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: lgall
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel as it was rated as 4 star for a wedding I was attending and found that the luxury we were expecting was nul and void. The lifts in the hotel are very claustrophobic. Got to our room and the only nice thing I can saw about it was that the sun was shining in the windows!. This hotel is more like a 2 star rated hotel. There were basic coffee making facilities. We were offered a complimentary glass of champagne on arrival, we had this at the roof top bar, which was covered in astro turf. The so called pool was no bigger than a bath and is just really a dip/plunge pool to cool you down. It didnt look too clean either. Food in the breakfast buffet was inedible. I asked for some scrambled eggs and bacon to be made and the staff in the dining room were very unpleasant, and in no way friendly. On the second day we arrived before the close of breakfast and were asked to hurry up with our food. The staff on reception were a totally different story, they were extremely helpful and curtious. Beware of pick pockets in the Ramblas, they obviously make a good living at this. I was robbed of my money and also the grooms father had his wallet robbed. I would not recommend staying here,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and fantastic view - would recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NicoYork
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Regente in early July with my girlfriend. It was a really nice hotel, the room we had was great, a small terrace at the rear of the hotel overlooking the city. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel as there are many cheaper cafes nearby that do serve breakfast all morning. Ideally located for exploring all of Barcelona in the 'nicer' part of the city. If I go back to Barca I will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A very positive surprise”
Reviews.Author: megamy
Reviews.Content: We (parents in the fifty's an 2 sons in the twenty's) had booked five nights at the HCC Taber Hotel but at arrival we were told, that we couldn't stay there and had to go to the Regente 2 blocks away. That was our luck. Regente is a fine Hotel, and as we arrived early we had our luggage deposed until the rooms were ready. I asked for at least one room facing the street (we had booked 2 rooms). We had 602 and 603. Two clean and comfortably rooms with exellent bath and a big terrasse overlooking the city. Well, there is rooms at the hotel facing shafts and backyard-walls, but we were assured, that if you should get such a room at arrival they would transfer you to a better room as soon as possible. But those rooms are far from romantic! There is no restaurant but a very fine breakfastlounge. Breakfast is not overwealming, but there is what you need. Eggs, bacon, sausages etc. are served if you only ask for it and there sure is a lot of cake (we're not used to that in DK). Of course coffie, juice, different fruit etc. We didn't visit the bar downstairs but only the top floor (8th) bar and pool. It is a very small pool, but what a place overlooking the town, and it is sufficient for cooling down after a long walk in the streets. At the reception they're doing everything to please you and I have to name Maria who is especially kind and helpful - and also one of the men but I don't remember his name (he was wearing glasses). They phone, make reservations and fix car-rental etc. for you and helps you in any way with a smile. At nighttime there also is a guard in the reception. The hotel is in walking distance to almost everything, and right outside there is the "rambla-life" in Rambla de Catalunya where you can eat and drink and relax all day long and in the "back-yard" is Passeig de Gracia" with a lot of life. 10 min. walk to Cataluanya place and the famous "Le Rambla". I'm only sorry that it isn't possible to book a special room directly for my next visit in Barcelona, but I'll certainly recommend the hotel very much, and if it was possible give it 6 stars in overall rating. I can't wait to visit Barcelona again ;o)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Mike096
Reviews.Content: On the Rambla de Catalunya, close to all the major modernist buildings, shops, bars and restuarants. 5 minutes walk from Passeig de Gracias rail and metro station. Area felt safe, unlike the chaos around the Las Ramblas. We had a quiet room at the side with a rooftop view (but rooms on the street were noisy). Room was clean and comfortable. Well-fitted bathroom. Good breakfast (included in our package). Rooftop terrace and bar has a wonderful view (but the "pool" is tiny - hardly more than a bathtub!).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: magentaOttawa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definately worth staying in - great location, we were able to walk to almost everywhere, subway is 2 blocks away, lots of restaurants and stores nearby. The rooms were small but clean and efficient. The best part of the hotel is the rooftop pool and patio. Great views! Drink service is friendly (but at times slow) The pool was extremely small - but it was fabulous to be able to soak my feet after the day's walk around Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “staff great, needs modenising”
Reviews.Author: roadsideshop
Reviews.Content: staff great , bar opens and closes at will , main complaint no resturant, breakfast only, had service in the roof bar ,had spanish pancake for over 5 euros ,this was the size of a 1/4 slice of bread , and varstley overpriced, swimming pool is also a con ! my bath is bigger , although not quite as deep ( 1metre ), rooms need a revamp to bring them upto date, carpet thread bare in parts. well ,what can i say , ? sounds bad , IT IS'NT I ENJOYED MY STAY THERE hope you don't get to confused by this. go see it is o.k.

Reviews.Title: “not bad for the price. good location.”
Reviews.Author: judsonmccann
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a weekend. Got a decent deal via lastminute.com. It was their 4-star "mystery" hotel. 4-star is a bit generous. It was more like a 3.25. No air conditioning, but I got an interior room facing a blind alley, so it was quiet as a tomb, even with the windows open. One of other occupants, who may have been under the influence of alcohol, was throwing wadded up Kleenex's into my open window and guffawing, but he settled down. As others have said, it's a short walk to everything Ramblas-wise. The rooftop deck and pool remained locked the entire time I was there, but it looked like some minor repairs may have been in progress. I didn't ask the staff for much, but they were very helpful with all of my requests, other than the doorman who looked at me as if I was interrupting his standing around.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: MemberfromPadova
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a friend. Nice location in a not-so-noisy area, yet very close to the heart of the city. Didn't use many of the facilities being on a business trip. But the room was very clean, comfortable and overall impression was definitely good. Very good value for money, having got a deal for less than € 100 per night. I would come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel (but that's about it)”
Reviews.Author: sebx
Reviews.Content: We only stayed in this hotel because some friends had already booked their rooms there. It's everything you hate about faceless hotels and didn't have a single element that makes you smile. Hold on, no, it did have free Internet on the room. And it was clean, but then these boring hotels always are. And they always cost EUR 100 excluding breakfast ...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful City - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Claymires
Reviews.Content: Had a weekend break to Barcelona and spent 3 pleasant nights at The Regente Hotel. The location of the hotel is great, in a quiet "local" area with lots of nice designer shops and patiseries, but still only a 10 minute walk to the Ramblas. Our room was a good size, immaculatley clean and with a view of the Sagrada Familia from the window! We also had an exercise bike in our room which is a first for me! We found the staff to be helpful and friendly throughout the hotel & the free glass of champagne on arrival was a nice touch! The continental breakfast is ok but I would avoid the hot breakfasts as what we ordered was cold and a bit oily. The only problem we had with the hotel, which wasnt major, was lack of tea or coffee making facilities in the room. After a hard days shopping and walking all round Barcelona it would have been nice to be able to have a cup of tea or coffee in the room. We ended up having to order tea through room service which obvioulsy wasnt the cheapest, and also room service stopped at 11.30. Apart from that the hotel was perferct. I would also recommend when visiting Barcelona that you go to Cardobes Flamenco Evening - very entertaining. NOTE:- Be careful when walking around the streets in Barcelona as at the moment they seem to have a really bad problem with pick-pockets (worse than normal) We wore money belts and had no problem, but we heard of quite a few others who got bags snatched, wallets & phones stollen.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Tuna Sandwiches”
Reviews.Author: Wopaz
Reviews.Content: Booked through Lastminute.com as one of their secret hotel deals. Not a bad location, away from the hustle and bustle of the Ramblas, but within walking distance of all of the key sites. Based in the area of the designer shops (Burberry, Diesel, Massimo Dutti etc...), very cool but very expensive. Hotel itself decent although nothing special. The roof terrace sets it apart from the average hotel - great for chilling out in the sun with a cool beer. Surprisingly sparsely populated too. Room pretty basic, but no problems with it. Slightly disappointed having read other reviews that we didnt get an exercise bike! Staff helpful, particularly Eric - who managed to perform an excellent Manuel impression with very little effort... Bonus is that when you ask for one tuna sandwich, you end up with two....

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant enough”
Reviews.Author: luvvacurry
Reviews.Content: This was OK but wouldn't consider it to be a 4 star hotel. There were a few pluses though: the reception staff (particularly Manuel) were very friendly, efficient and really helpful. We got there early after getting off a cruise and luckily were able to check in OK. The pastries at breaksfast were gorgeous! Got a free welcome Cava served by a very friendly barman. Hotel room was spotlessly clean. Sweet terrace with a stunning view. Watched a thunderstorm in the distance and it was spectacular. Toiletries OK and free bedroom slippers. Minus points: steps up to reception with heavy luggage, small pool (like a pond!), cooked breakfast included hot dog sausages and scrambled eggs which was an omelette chopped up. Room was in a dark and dingy corner somewhere and the view comprised of a wall and windows with an air conditioning unit covered in pigeon poo and cigarette butts. The shower head couldn't be adjusted. Perhaps we got this room because we arrived so early. Suggest you ask for one with a balcony overlooking rambla de catalunya. Location was not for us as it was in the business and fashion area (eg nearby Chanel and Prada shops) - it lacked 'local' atmosphere. No double bed but two singles. Only one small flat pillow per bed with no spares. Stayed on Sunday night but were disconcerted to find a security guard patrolling reception to protect the only female receptionist on duty! Overall a perfectly acceptable hotel, but not 4 stars in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: v1ckyh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in March 2008. Initial impressions of the hotel were positive, the hotel is located centrally and almost all of the attractions we wanted to see were in walking distance. There is a small but pleasant reception area in the hotel and the staff were very helpful and spoke good english. Our room overlooked the Rambla de Catalunya and was high up so we had a fantastic view of the city (especially the Montejuic area). The room had 2 double beds pushed together and was a generous size, the balcony was also big enough to sit out on and would have been fantastic if we had visited in summer. The bathroom was spacious, nicely decorated and included the usual amenities. Throughout, the room was spotlessly clean. As it was winter season I can't comment on the pool area, although we did use the small bar area and the waiter was very nice and helpful. We were given a complimentary drink voucher on check in which was a nice tough. As we spent very little time in the hotel the review is fairly short, although we would stay here again in the future if we visited Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: lisa_d17
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 week in a twin room at the Regente in late April. Was somewhat concerned given some of the reviews, but ended up being pleasantly surprised. The location was absolutely perfect. Close to everything, but in a quieter area. Good restaurants and great shopping all very close. Always felt safe when walking at night. No problem with pickpockets despite all the warnings. Did take all the safety advice to heart though, so maybe that helped. The front desk staff spoke english to varying degrees, from fluent to struggling, but all were extremely helpful and friendly. The room was typical for the price range in Europe...smaller than you'd expect in North America, but more than big enough for 2. Very large bathroom. Inexplicable exercise bike taking up valuable floor space. Rooms cleaned early and spotlessly every day. Large buffet breakfast with a wide range of choices, including hot dishes. Minor negatives: Twin room was 2 twin beds pushed together. Not a problem for us (mother and daughter travelling together) but maybe a little cozy for 2 friends or 2 business associates. No way to separate the beds. Room and closets maybe a little small for 2 women with lots of clothing. TV reception not great, but miraculously better on nights when the Champions League was being played. Overall, would highly recommend and if I return to Barcelona will definitely consider as a first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Family holiday at HCC Regente”
Reviews.Author: ScotTravelScotland
Reviews.Content: Wanted a triple room for 3 adults, room was OK but not a triple, more like a double with an extra single bed. Room too small, no room to store 3 suitcases, plus an exercise bike took up space and was unused. Room and bathroom were clean, room looked on to an alleyway with a building a few feet away. Buffet breakfast was OK but the hot water to make tea was always lukewarm and the coffee in a jug looked and tasted like lukewarm mud. The room safe costs 6.75 euros per night plus VAT, which is an absolute ripoff. Be aware also that if you want to pay your bill by traveller cheques they will not accept them, we had an altercation with the reception staff at check-out, but after checking with the duty manager they eventually did accept them, if they don't accept some methods of payment they should clearly display that information instead of embarrassing guests. All in all, the hotel is OK, quite good location, reception staff efficient but not very friendly and don't acknowledge guests as they move past the desk. On one occasion we went past the desk to the lift, went to the 5th floor then found that the door (opposite side to get out) would not open. We went back down and told the staff that the doors did not work, there response was, "yes we know, we are working on it" but they did not think to tell us before we went up in the lift. Of course we then had to walk up the stairs. To get into the hotel you go up 8 or nine steps, on arrival there was no one at the door to help with suitcases. The roof terrace was locked during our stay so we did not get to see the city views. Would rate this as a 3 star hotel, not 4.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in thief-infested town”
Reviews.Author: JD777
Reviews.Content: Great location, very friendly staff. Decent room, somewhat worn. All but sound-proof, nice if you want to hear what your neighbours are talking about. Not much noise from the streets though. Perhaps not really what you'd expect of a 4*-rated hotel but still enough to be satisfying if you're not very picky. Never tried the breakfast. The city overall was, especially given its immense popularity, a suprisingly unpleasant experience - foremost due to theft - but the hotel itself was more than ok. Would go back to the hotel - if it was located in another town..

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: An0ther
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regente for a long weekend in April - arriving Thur night and leaving Sunday. The hotel is very central and is great for exploring the city. We opted for a room without a view and i'm glad we did - seeing the amount of traffic that runs through the streets of the City I can only assume those room would have been a lot noisier! The rooms were comfortable (if a little old fashioned) two single beds pushed together rather than a double. But the place was clean. In general the hotel could do with a freshen up. The breakfast was good - general buffet style. We only found out on the last day that you can order hot food (only a few of the tables had these menues available). Overall I would recomend this hotel - I would say a 3* rather than a 4*.

Reviews.Title: “Would expect a lot more from 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: janakay78
Reviews.Content: While the hotel has got a fairly good central location, I certainly would not rate it as 4* hotel. The room was very average, bed + bed linen was rather unconfortable and certainly not warm enough. Bathroom was too small to turn around, and while taking a shower, water temperature would be constantly changing. For some reason there as an excercise bike, but they somehow forgot simple things such a kettle. I would neither stay nor recommend this HCC hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: HarleyGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Initially booked into a room with no view. Requested a balcony room to the front and staff moved our cases the next morning to a superb room overlooking Rambla De Catalunia . Staff extremely pleasant. Hotel clean. Breakfast good value and varied.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: samber_7
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its central location and were not disappointed. There were plenty of restaurants and shops nearby and the street led straight down to La Rambla. After reading reviews on this site we specifically requested a room with a balcony and view and were given an excellent room on the sixth floor. The hotel was attractive and clean and the staff friendly and helpful. The Gaudi/ Picasso Guided Bus Tour recommended by the hotel was excellent and well worth the 38 euro per person as it took in Park Gueill, the Sagrada Familia and the Picasso museum as well as a Bus Tour around the highlights of the city. Taxis were very reasonably priced too.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you like natural light! More a 2 to 3 star not 4.”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyerSeaford
Reviews.Content: Superb location in Eixample, 10 mins N of Catalunya, 20 mins walk to heart of old city but quieter area. However, the room (106) was pokey, hardly any natural light, bathroom very poorly ventilated, plumbing noise awful and sound insulation non existent between rooms. Breakfast buffet open to the elements and lots of flies 7am to 11am, bread and meat dry by 09:30. Far too expensive for the accommodation offered.

Reviews.Title: “get the right room!”
Reviews.Author: ejer
Reviews.Content: arrived 27/8/2007 for five days--room 208 looked onto a yard but knew to ask for a change from one of your reportees! secured room 303 the following day which overlooked the square through a french balconyfestooned with geraniums ---superb. bus turistica tour of city worthwhile .qu qu restaurant passeig de gracia 24 barcelona serving good food and a very nice jug of sangria most reasonable.a lebanese gentleman bumped into us in las rambla ,heard our scottish accent ,asked if he could look at scottish notes and yes before you knew it we were opening our wallets,only maybe 50 euros between us at that time ---not worth stealing!!! move on to the next unsuspecting tourist --cant believe we were so gullible--==beware!! that aside --a wonderful holiday

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hamppu
Reviews.Content: Hcc Regente is conveniently located close to Las Ramblas and Placa de Catalunya. Antoni Tàpies's museum is just around the corner and also two of Antoni Gaudi's buildings on Passeig de Grazia Avenue are close by. The hotel is very small and doesn't have many amenities. However, because it is small, it is also fairly quiet. Some of the staff doesn't speak fluent english. But this didn't matter, because there were always two persons at the reception. The hotel was tidy and the lobby and breakfast room were nicely decorated. But there were some problems in our room: the air-conditioner was quite lousy, either it was too cold or the room began to smell bad if you turned it off. One of the reasons why we booked this hotel was the swimming pool on the roof terrace. Well, what can one say about it, it's a joke. It was 1 meter deep and perhaps 4 x 2 meters in size. Don't believe the pictures of the pool or the terrace shown on the hotel website. Also the safety deposit box was expensive, 6,5 euros per day. On the good side, the staff was friendly and the breakfast service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing stay at the Regente”
Reviews.Author: ameliaUK
Reviews.Content: Breakfasts excellent, rooms high standard, and staff helpful Swimming pool?? a little on the small side! and the daily charge for the room safe key rankled a little. Otherwise an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and Value in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: TillyNewYork
Reviews.Content: We did a thorough search of hotels in Barcelona and chose the Regente partly because of its location close to our relatives who live in the city. We were immediately impressed with the décor and the helpful staff. On our reservation, we had noted that we were celebrating our 35th wedding anniversary and found a bottle of champagne cooling in our room upon arrival! The room was very quiet and comfortable and had a balcony overlooking Rambla Catalunya which set our room back a bit from the street noise. The view was wonderful! Another plus was the lovely rooftop snack bar which is opened from noon till 9 p.m. each day. From there the views are gorgeous and the light meals delicious. Our first day at the hotel, some repairs were unexpectedly begun in the balcony area outside our room. The staff could not have been more apologetic or helpful. They changed our room, offered us free breakfast for the duration of our trip, and informed the manager of our plight. He came to greet us at the rooftop bar and bought us and our relatives complimentary drinks. He more than made up for the inconvenience of having to change rooms and added to the enjoyment of our visit. Everything in Barcelona is expensive but we thought the Regente gave us a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bonnielassieGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We are just back from staying at this great hotel. We asked for a quiet room and we were giving a room on the first floor looking on to a wall but as we only use our room to sleep we did not have a problem with this. Lovely and comfortable, did not have coffee making facilities but as they had room service, bar and the rooftop terrace, plenty of places to have coffee if needed. The rooftop terrace was brilliant, the pool which they hotel make no secret of the fact is very small but the terrace was great to rest after the long days of walking. Unfortunately our holiday was marred by the theft of my boyfriends rucksack at the magic fountain, we still do not know how this happened, we class ourselves very street wise and we went to a quiet part with no one about before or after the event, John just put sun tan lotion on my shoulders and it was gone along with his passport/credit cards and other bits and pieces. The hotel manager gave us both a drink and also gave us a bottle of Cava. It is a shame because it is a beautiful city but the amount of people in the police station filling in forms and the things I have heard before and after it will soon lose its tourists if they do not do something about it. Linda

Reviews.Title: “great location very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: spitfire7
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel just back after 2 day stay with wife11th-13th dec 2006,great location for shops and night life .you don,t have to walk down to la ramba ,excellent shops and cafes around the vicinity of hotel ,staff very pleasant and helpful.walk into the heart of la ramba 5 mins.Would use hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Happyscots
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the HCC Regente for 4 nights in October. This hotel is in a perfect location very near to some of Gaudi's famous buildings. The staff in the reception were extremely friendly. We were originally placed in a large double room, however, it had a view of a fire escape! We asked if it would be possible to change rooms. The next morning, they moved all our belongings to a room on the 6th floor with a large balcony to sit and watch the world go by! It was a beautiful room and had the most amazing views of the Eixample area of Barcelona. The buffet breakfast had everything you could wish for to start the day. The nearest metro stop is just around the corner (as is the airport bus stop) but it is only a 10-15 minute walk down to the waterfront passing Las Ramblas on the way. It is in the upmarket shopping area and there was plenty places to eat and drink on your doorstep. We would definately stay here again and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A GEM!”
Reviews.Author: corsaking
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem . Owned by the HCC group you will find others dotted about Barcelona. The staff are very polite and courteous and will greet you every time you walk through the main door. Requesting a single room i found I had a large double room with tv, nice bathroom and even an exercise bike. Nice touches on arrival were a complimentary CD which features relaxing music, sweets, and shampoo soap razor etc. Theres even a phone in the bathroom useful i thought if you had an accident or it rang when you were in the shower. The breakfast was ample and you could have a hot meal like omlette at no extra cost . After youve walked all day visit the rooftop pool area. OK its not olympic but you can soak yourself in the heat of the day to cool off. You can eat and drink on the terrace too. The steps at the front of the hotel could do with a ramp then the suitcases with wheels could be managed easier but if your able bodied its not too much a problem .Theres no door staff to help you. Eating out is not a problem .Your spoilt for choice Sightseeing buses can be reached by walking straight down the Rambla de Catalunya until you reach the Plaza Catalunya. A short walk further is Las Ramblas. Be prepared to walk and get some good walking shoes and make sure your feet are in order. Queen(Freddie Mercury) was so inspired he wrote a song about Barcelona Go visit it and youll see why.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: VGils
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking forward to celebrating our 1st year wedding anniversary in Barcelona and had everything crossed that the hotel and the location would be okay. We need not have worried!!!! We emailed the hotel prior to our arrival to let them know we were celebrating and I'm not sure if this had any influence over the fantastic room we were given. The room (708)was huge with the biggest outside terrace I have ever seen (about 15 x 15 feet in area). Sitting out there on an evening with the lights and fireworks was a dream. The rest of the hotel was great as well! The buffet breakfast was plentiful with lots of choice and the staff could not have been more helpful. We asked for a recommendation for our anniversary meal and were directed to the Cerveseria Catalana one block up to the left which had the best tapas we tasted all holiday.....so good we ate there twice!!!! The roof terrace and bar was also a lovely place to spend an hour or two relaxing after a hectic but wonderful day of sightseeing. Granted as the rest of the reviews point out, don't expect to be able to go for a swim in the pool as it is jacuzzi sized but to be honest we didn't miss it! The drinks are a little bit more expensive but compared to british prices still a good deal. The hotel location is brilliant as well. It it about a five minute walk (five blocks) from the Placa de Catalunya and the start of the Las Ramblas and the surrounding neighbourhood is one of the best and safest in the city. I would highly recommend jumping on the tourist buses that circle the major sights of the city as this is a great way to get oriented and to make sure you don't miss any of the major sights on your visit. Must sees: Parc Gruell (do this early morning if you can as it involves a lot of walking, mostly uphill) Nou Camp (even for the non football fan it is awesome) Bus tours on both the North and South routes Las Ramblas ensuring you stop into the market halfway down on your right as you are walking to the sea and the Barri Gotic which is off to your left on Las Ramblas. The Port area below Columbus' column to cool off with a refreshing drink and to watch the boats. We have definitely lost our hearts to the wonderful city that is Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Regente”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regente for 2 nights as a surprise birthday celebration for my partner. The hotel was within walking distance of the Ramblas (which we loved) and of the Placa de Catalunya. On checking in the staff where extremely helpful and friendly and provided us with tour guides and a welcome drink which was lovely. Unfortunately as we stayed in February the hotel bar itself was very quiet but again the barman was very friendly and made us feel most welcome whenever we visited. The breakfast was fantastic and if anybody said there was no choice and they didnt realise there were hot breakfasts then I cannot see how - it was clearly marked on the menus on each table that there were hot breakfasts - as well as every food youcould probably think of! The rooftop pool would have been great as it was warm and sunny when we stayed but unfortunately it was closed during February which we were not aware of. I suppose in February it was to be expected but as it was a nice day we could have sat on the terrace and enjoyed a glass of cava or 2. The room was nicely decorated, spotlessly clean and the bathroom was well stocked with toiletries. We were lucky enough to have a top floor room which over looked the city and you could see the Gaudi Sanfamilias from our room. We had a lovely surprise on our first evening - the hotel staff sent a bottle of cava on ice to us for my partners birthday - it made the stay very special and i would definitely recommend anyone staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very central hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: CLEVERCLOGS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend break and found the hotel to be very good value. It is situated at the top of La Ramblas and is very central for everything that you could wish to do in Barcelona. The square is a 5-10 minute walk away and from here you get the tourist buses which practically run all day, every day. The drinks in the hotel are expensive 12.20 euros for 2 diet cokes and 1 vodka. We didn't buy any more drinks from the hotel after that! The breakfast is continental and the only hot thing on offer is boiled eggs which are sometimes so cold they are tasteless. IF YOU WANT A HOT BREAKFAST, YOU HAVE TO ASK - IT IS INCLUDED IN THE PRICE. They do sausages, bacon and omelette - which we didn't find out about until our last day. The fruit cocktail is tinned and is not very nice. Also, the fruit juices that are served seem to be at room temperature. Sometimes they have ice beside the jugs so you can put some ice in to cool it down. It does take the staff some time to replenish the food, I asked for more tomatoes and cucumber and I waited at least 15 mins before it was brought out. Rooms are spacious enough, however, ours had a view of the fire escape so wasn't particularly picturesque, but we were only sleeping in it so it didn't matter. The staff are courteous and friendly, we asked for extra pillows and they were delivered within 5 minutes. They are also good at organising taxis for you and they do seem to go out of their way to smile, which is something that a lot of hotel staff seem to forget to do. Taxis are expensive when phoning them as they arrive with 3 or 4 euros on the meter. We ordered a taxi to take us to the water fountains - which are absolutely beautiful. It's an illuminated display with music and the show start from 9.00 until 11.00pm and are every 30 minutes. From the hotel, the taxi should be about 6 or 7 euros. The show is fantastic - AND IT IS FREE. There are lots of nice bistro type cafes in the area and they are a lot cheaper than further down La Ramblas. We tried THE ATTIC restaurant and had a lovely meal. Don't order your steak medium rare as it comes out RARE. I should have sent it back to be grilled for a few more minutes, but I was starving. My husband had the lamb and it looked - and tasted - delicious. It may be a bit pricier than the surrounding areas but it is a nice relaxed restaurant with good quality food on offer. If you're coming from Barcelona airport, the average cost of a taxi to this hotel is 25-30 euros. So it's much cheaper to arrange your own taxi than let the flight operator organise it. We were quoted 43 euros by one company. This is a very nice hotel, it's not too noisy at night, unlike La Ramblas where they are presently playing pan pipe music until at least midnight. It sounds okay when you are listening to it in the street, but I would imagine that after an hour or so that it would drive you demented! All in all - a very nice hotel - central, courteous staff, nice breakfast (if you opt for the hot one) and very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Though we asked the room with balcony which is shown their ad photo, we are given a room with small balcony(just enough to stand) froned to Rambla de Catalunya. Size of room was just OK and clean enough. Service was so, so, nothing very special. The location is perfect for shopping and dining, close enough to Gaudi architectures. Nice cafes are in the same street. Two dissapointing things: 1) they chage safety box, 5 Euro/day, 2) they charge Internet, Euro 3.5/15 min. Most of hotel offer these services for free. Forget roof top terrace and swimming pool. Swimming pool is just bath size, not for swimming. Roof top terrace has no atmosphere and open only 10-20. We did not use both.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel HCC Regente
HotelInfo.Address: Rambla de Catalunya 76, 08008 Barcelona, Spain
